intro: Blepharodon auyantepuiense, commonly known as the Angel's Tears Plant, is a unique species native to the tepuis of Venezuela. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its striking, velvety blue flowers. The plant thrives in the humid, rocky environments of the tepui plateaus, where it has adapted to the unique microclimates. Its leaves are typically broad and thick, designed to retain moisture in the arid conditions of its habitat. Due to its restricted distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
